81.title: Software Engineer
81.description:
BBC News offers a wide range of stretching, creative and impactful careers for talented people. We are the team that’s building the future of the BBC, whilst delivering TV, radio and online services to millions of people worldwide every day. 

In the Elections Team we are focused on giving the public clear information about the democratic process. We’re a full-stack team focused on getting accurate information about elections results to our audience quickly, at scale and most importantly clearly. Often our audiences either don’t understand the electoral process, the terminology used or struggle with numbers, and it’s part of the BBC’s remit to help make this clear. 

We offer challenging work but with the time to think and do things right. We value Diversity & Inclusion everywhere at the BBC and encourage people of all backgrounds to apply for the role. 

If you are interested to know more about us, please explore the following links: 


 
 Blogs: https://medium.com/bbc-design-engineering 
 
 
 OpenSource: https://www.bbc.co.uk/opensource/ 
 
 
 GitHub: https://github.com/bbc 
 
 
 General D+E info: https://www.bbc.com/backstage/design-engineering 
 
Technical: 


 
 Our stack is built from JavaScript and GoLang. If you don’t know them, we can train you, so demonstrable skill in: JavaScript, TypeScript, Python, Java, GoLang are all acceptable if you’re willing to learn. 
 
 
 We operate as a DevOps team and own our own infrastructure on AWS; experience of working in this way is a plus. 
 
 
 Knowledge of SQL databases, or any other databases a plus. 
 



 
 Championing new technologies and approaches to ensure our products remain world class. 
 
 
 Collaborating effectively to deliver the best value audience experience. 
 
 
 Ensuring your code meets high quality standards through testing and peer reviews. 
 


People: 


 
 Working with others to get things done in a proactive and positive way. 
 



 
 Working with journalists and designers on new application concepts and building prototypes. 
 
 
 Contributing to an environment of engineering excellence and continuous improvement. 
 
 
 Mentoring and training new team members. 
 
 
 Contributes to creating safe and inclusive working environments. 
 
We’re keen to speak with people who have experience designing, developing and supporting large, complex systems at scale with one or more modern programming languages and/or frameworks. This is a great opportunity to learn new skills and languages. We’d also be keen to see experience of cloud infrastructure and automated testing techniques. 

Experience of project working and professional software development processes including Agile, behaviour driven development and test-driven development would be preferable, as well as supporting software in a production environment. Finally, we value experience communicating effectively with both technical and non-technical colleagues at all levels in an organisation. 

We create and support reliable and scalable, cloud-based systems on Amazon Web Services, use Git and GitHub for version control, continuous integration and continuous deployment. 

                             
                                
                                    Proud member of the Disability Confident employer scheme

It is important to note that in certain recruitment situations such as high-volume, seasonal and high-peak times, the employer may wish to limit the overall numbers of interviews offered to both disabled people and non-disabled people. For more details please go to Disability Confident.

85.title: Junior or Graduate Software Engineer
85.description: Graduate or Junior Software EngineerEstablished in 1985, Crowder Consulting consists of a growing team of over 120 consulting engineers, software developers and data analysts. As an SME, we are able to offer our leading Water Network Management System, Netbase, to water operators in the UK and internationally. Our flagship Netbase System is a data rich hub that acts as a Digital Twin of our client water operators’ networks, with a suite of best practice applications providing source to tap insights for network monitoring, operation, optimisation, management and regulatory reporting. Our Netbase Digital Services Platform extends the value and insights of the Netbase Data Hub, providing advanced web-based technologies and solutions supporting innovative analytics, operational, field services and leakage activities. Our people are at the heart of what we do, and we’re proud to say we’ve been Investors in People accredited since 2004, testament to our dedication to support all colleagues with their career development. We are looking for Junior Software Engineers or Computer Science graduates to join our Development Team and help drive the ambitious roadmap for our cloud-based solutions and services. The Role – Graduate or Junior Software EngineerAs a Software Engineer, you’ll work with some of the latest technologies and be involved in the end-to-end software development life cycle. You’ll carry out requirements analysis working closely with our in-house domain experts; designing, developing, and testing components, APIs, and applications; monitoring and supporting operational systems and implementing dev-ops best practice and researching new technologies, prototyping, and bringing innovation to our solutions.The PackageAs a Junior or Graduate Software Engineer, you’ll benefit from:• A starting salary of £25,000 (or higher, dependent upon your experience, skills, and qualifications)• Permanent contract, working 37.5 hours per week, Monday to Friday, with flexible start times between 8am and 10am and finish times between 4:30pm and 6:30pm • Employer contributory pension scheme• Annual leave entitlement that increases with length of serviceWe’re based in Birkenhead, although there may be a requirement for you to work from home initially due to the Covid-19 Government restrictions. We’re reviewing a hybrid approach to working post-Covid as suited to business requirements. Our Requirements – Graduate or Junior Software EngineerYou should be enthusiastic about the latest software trends and technologies and have a willingness to learn, progress and grow within the team. You’ll also have: • Degree level education in Computer Science or relevant subject and / or a foundation of experience within a similar software engineering role• Experience of a high-level programming language (Java, Python, NodeJS, TypeScript, C#)• Appreciation of Software Development practices and design (OOAD, DDD, TDD, patterns)Although not essential, exposure to any of the following would be advantageous:• Developing desktop, web, or mobile applications• Cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, GCP, Serverless, Containers) • Web technologies (REST API, HTML5, JavaScript, Angular, React)• Database technologies (Oracle, MySQL, Mongo, DynamoDB, etc)• DevOps Practices and Tools (Configuration as code, CI/CD, Docker)• Experience of working in an agile environmentAll applications for this Junior or Graduate Software Engineer vacancy are to be submitted online, and strictly no agency calls or agency CV submissions.

94.title: Associate Software Engineer
94.description: Are you starting your career as a Software Engineer?Are you looking for an engaging environment with the opportunity to deliver innovative technology?We’re looking for outstanding Software Engineers, who want to contribute to demanding and exciting digital services for the UK Government. Be part of changing the face of public services with the potential to dramatically transform the future of millions of people. Our Engineers build and run applications as part of a multi-functional agile delivery teams. What really excites the successful candidate is problem-solving and the opportunity to deliver technology that carries real value for users. The candidate will be expected to draw value from collaboration with others, actively seek input from colleagues and value a multidisciplinary team over hierarchy.The successful candidate will join Identity and Trust (ID&T) within Shared Channels Experience. ID&T is tasked with accurately establishing customers’ identity when interacting with DWP services regardless of the form of communication, protecting both DWP and the customer while removing the need to repeatedly undergo identification processes throughout the journey.Check out these blogs aboutAs an Associate Software Engineer you will help develop and maintain software products that make up citizen and organisation facing services and contribute towards their design.Working with a team, you will be responsible for the operational stability of the products you build, and be in a position to affect change in the on-going robustness and resilience of those products.You will work within, and contribute to, the overall Software Development Lifecycle Process as part of a multi-functional Agile delivery team focused on one or more products.You will:• Deliver software products which make up services for our citizens to consume.• Ensure system robustness, resilience and stability.• Help design and develop reusable libraries and services and promote reuse across the department.• Collaborate to produce comprehensive suites of automated unit and integration tests to ensure code quality.• Identify and resolve issues preventing delivery or continuation of software engineering activities.

109.title: Software Engineer
109.description: Are you an outstanding Application Engineer with extensive knowledge of C#?Do you think you can contribute to the digital services demand in the DWP?Do you want to help change the face of public services?If the answer to these three question is ‘Yes’ then you could be our next Software Engineer. We’re looking for you to use your C# skills to develop, maintain, change and support an application as part of a multi-functional agile team.What really excites our engineers is problem-solving and the opportunity to deliver innovative technology that carries real value for users. You will be expected to draw value from collaboration with others, actively seek input from colleagues and value a multidisciplinary team over hierarchy.As an Engineering Practice Member you will have access to a range of L&D opportunities to support both your professional and personal development. You will also become part of the software engineering community.As a Software Engineer you will: • Be part of a small team acting as the C# technical lead for the ongoing development of a key system. • Work closely with the product owner and experts across DWP and contribute to the ongoing development, support and administration of the system. • Demonstrate your C# skills on day to day development requirements and project activities, to innovate and to provide technical support for colleagues within a multi-disciplined team. • Provide coaching and mentoring to Application Engineer colleagues and peers by utilising pair-programming. • Implement best-practices to code securely, developing the application to reflect agreed requirements to agreed priorities (C# and SQL). • Deliver quality software which is easy to maintain and clean to operate and troubleshoot issues related to the application – technical and user related. • Provide technical support on a specific application.• Identify and resolve technical issues related to the application.• Need a track record of developing and enhancing legacy systems, refactoring to enhance digital opportunities and up-skilling of colleagues. The system is constantly evolving to meet new requirements, as are the opportunities to enhance the system.

112.title: Software Engineers
112.description: We are seeking multiple Software Engineers at all levels to join a global Marketplace Services Platform that helps brands and retailers grow their sales on Amazon. Whether you have approx. two years commercial / Freelance experience (Level II) or you are a mid-senior Software Engineer (Level III), we would love to hear from you.You will need to be based in the UK or EU and willing to occasionally travel to attend networking and team building events (expenses paid for anyone well outside London). Offering a broad range of strategic, optimisation, management, and advertising services in the UK and internationally, this new Global Marketplace Services Platform helps brands grow their sales on Amazon and other platforms. With a very competitive salary on offer and a superb benefits package that includes Free Amazon Prime, Flexible working, Contributory pension, Technology allowance -£500 one off, 25 Days holiday, your birthday off, access to an industry leading learning platform, Cycle to work scheme, Bike storage (if you attend the office), expect a fantastic opportunity to progress your career and be an integral part of the business helping shape and build the platform.  Reporting to the Technical Lead, the successful Software Engineers will become an integral part of the business helping build and shape this platform as they develop new concepts and transition them to production maturity. To qualify… You should be a Software Engineer /Software Developer / JavaScript Developer / Software Developer / Full Stack Developer / TypeScript Developer / Python Developer or similar who can demonstrate: A degree in computer science, STEM or another numerate subject or be able to show additional commercial experience. A background of commercial or freelance software development.Experience developing web applications, data extraction tools, data pipelines, or ETL processes. An understand the software development life cycle and agile processes. Good communications skills and can express technical challenges in lay-man’s terms. A passion for working with a remote team and agile processes. You are comfortable working to best practices such as continuous integration and deployment, monitoring, code reviews, linting, and testing. Be familiar with SOLID design principles. Technical Skills Our client work with a variety of technologies. The successful candidates should bring at least 2 years (Level II) or approx. 5 years (Level III) experience working with a mix of these skillsLanguage/Tool Skills: JavaScript (highly desired)Typescript (desired)Python (highly desired)SQL (required)Data Skills (highly desired)Numerical Framework such as Numpy, PandasVisualization Frameworks such as D3js, Charting Libraries or BI ToolsBasic Data Analysis and Data Science skillsRelational databases such as PostgresOther Database/warehouse solutions such as Redshift, AWS Glue, Spark, AWS Athena, or MongoDBBI Tools such as Tableau or PowerBIFronted Development Skills (Desired)Backend Frameworks such as Rest, SOAP, or WebSocketFrontend Frameworks such as Angular or DjangoDesign Frameworks such as Material UI or BootstrapBackend Development Skills (Desired)Serverless processesMicroservices and Event driven developmentMessaging and Task QueuesInfrastructure Skills (Desired)HerokuAWS (network security, RDS, Lambda, …)Google FirebaseLinux ServerDocker/KubernetesOur client work in an agile environment and developers will be expected to work with common tools for documentation, code reviews, requirements management, as well as CI and CD. This is a rare opportunity for a passionate Software Engineer to make a real impact joining a rapidly growing, well-funded start up. Get in touch… As part of your application, please provide a brief summary of your relevant technical experience and skills, as well as your desired level and desired level and current or last salary. More junior candidates (Level II) can expect £40k to 55k depending on skills and locationWhilst more experienced / mid weight candidates (Level III) can expect £55k to 65k depending on skills and location.

115.title: Software Engineer
115.description:
Please note: You must have the Right To Work in the UK to be considered for this role.
Want to use your coding skills in a different way whilst working from home?
BPAS are looking for an enthusiastic developer with Microsoft SQL, C# and JavaScript programming skills to be involved in the full system development lifecycle from ‘idea’ to ‘delivery’.
As a software engineer you will be directly contributing to making a real difference in BPAS. You will be involved and valued for your contribution in a small, friendly, highly skilled IT team supporting an organisation that is extremely ambitious in its plans for the future.
The role:
You will provide a high-quality software development and systems integration service to meet BPAS’s evolving business requirements. With a good understanding and practical experience in software development you will design, code, verify, test, document, amend and maintain complex programs/scripts and integration software services to achieve well engineered outcomes.
About You:
We are looking for a confident and articulate software engineer with solid “hands-on” experience in a similar role. You’ll be technically adept in Microsoft SQL, JavaScript and jQuery/ Angular, C#, .Net with good working knowledge of Visual Studio, SQL Server Management Studio and Subversion, Git or similar.
You will have an ability to communicate with colleagues at all levels of the organisation in a positive and friendly manner and a methodical, disciplined, and analytical approach to problem solving.
You will bring;

Qualified to a degree level in a Computer Science or Technology discipline or be able to demonstrate work experience to an equivalent level
Experience of investigating, identifying, and contributing to the resolution of software and technical issues, engaging effectively with third party suppliers and specialist resources as appropriate.
Technical coding ability
Experience in systems integration
Experience developing and maintaining system documentation using appropriate tools and techniques.

What we can offer you:
As a valued member of our IT team you will benefit from training opportunities supporting you to develop your skills and knowledge.
You’ll also have access to the BPAS Pension Plan, generous annual leave entitlement, the opportunity to attend in-house conferences, and gain access to the BHSF benefits plan.
Further Information:
Location: Home based or a hybrid arrangement incorporating our Head Office at Stratford upon Avon depending on candidate preference.
There is an expectation that the successful candidate will undertake some out of hours working for maintenance activities which will be paid as overtime. There will also be some very occasional travel to our units - travel expenses will be reimbursed.
Salary: Competitve dependent on skills and experience.
Working pattern and hours: 36 hours flexible across the week Monday to Friday in core business hours
For an informal chat about this role please call Chris Sharkey on 07540115937.

116.title: Software Engineer
116.description: What the job is about:New customer projects and a changing architecture landscape result in a bigger workload in which you can help us out by joining our Software Engineering team.As a Java Software Engineer, you’ll work on our core product ‘Miles’, an ERP software package covering all business aspects of a modern leasing company, automotive finance, or mobility provider.You’ll either work on improving the current application, developing new modules, or sometimes implement a customization project for one of the customers.'Miles’ is built in Java (Java 8-11 / Quarkus / Smart GWT). The database technologies that are currently used are Oracle, SQL Server, and expanding to PostgreSQL.Innovation is important, that’s why we’re making the shift to a next-generation microservices architecture with a fully integrated CI/CD pipeline, using technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes, and Kafka.You will work in an international organization, but one that has an informal atmosphere. It’s an environment in which you can take responsibility and initiative, share your ideas, and take part in the discussion.Your interests and skills:You have a bachelor's or master's degree in Computer Science, Informatics, or an equivalent degree.You are passionate about building state-of-the-art solutions in Java Enterprise and you have some experience or interest in other current technologies.You love solving problems in a creative manner together with your team. You do this in a methodical way and continuously strive for results and quality.Since Sofico is an international company, being fluent in English is important. You might be interested in our extended technology stack: Java JEE (8-11), Java Eclipse Microprofile, Quarkus, Junit, SQL, Oracle, MS SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Bamboo, Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes, Kafka, Helm Charts, Git, ...We are looking for junior, medior as well as senior profiles.What we offer:The opportunity to be part of a company that has been in business for over 30 years and is doubling in size every 5 years.An extensive onboarding program for you to become familiar with the product and the organization.A community-driven organization supporting you in all aspects of your daily job, heavily focusing on knowledge sharing, best practices, and training.The possibility to keep learning, acquire the desired skills, and be the driver of your own career.Of course, an attractive salary package based on your knowledge and experience with a company car.And in a normal situation, coffee, tea, water are available at the office, occasional after works drinks, a BBQ in the summer, and lots of other fun team events.

117.title: Software Engineer
117.description:
Software Engineer | Cheshire | 37.5 hours per week| £35,000 - £42,000Guardian Controls is an electronics company specialising in the design and manufacture of energy efficient controls and monitoring to the refrigeration industry in the UK, Europe and internationally.We are growing and ambitious in our plans for the future and are looking to recruit a Software Engineer who will focus on embedded industrial software with control systems encompassing analogue IO, digital IO, VSDs, sensors and actuators. The right candidate will have 4-5 years commercial experience and be keen to evolve and apply their skills further.You will work Monday to Friday - 9:00am to 5:00pm. There will be some flexibility in the number of hours worked and working days for the right candidate. The probationary period is 4 months, once completed this will be a permanent position.You Should Ideally Be Capable Of
• Excellent C and C++ programming skills.• Java, Javascript and HTML desired.• Assembly language with embedded Atmel and Microchip microcontrollers• Good Understanding of Windows development with C/C++ and MFC. • C# desired but not essential.• Good understanding of serial communications interfaces• Serial protocols such as Modbus desired• Serial device interfaces such as I2C and SPI desirable.• Understanding of TCP/IP protocol stack desired (TCP/IP, DHCP etc.)• Understanding of socket-based communications (TCP / UDP and higher layers: FTP, HTTP.• Knowledge of lower layers of TCP-IP stack is desirable, but not essential.• Understanding of cloud-based services and communications.• Understanding of WIFI communications• Experience with small footprint embedded systems development• Understanding of control systems theory with appreciation for industrial environment.• Understanding of SVN and git source control systems
Role ResponsibilitiesTaking direction from our head of engineering you will be responsible for the development of architecture, design, implementation, test and roll out of software for control systems in the refrigeration industry, both UK and Internationally. Working on a range of existing and new products, in varying hardware platforms to implement new control systems or modify and release improved features for existing products. You will work on small footprint embedded micro controllers with our in-house designed hardware with software interfacing to the hardware, reading sensors and controlling actuators. Our products are becoming more internet connected, an understanding of TCP-IP would be desirable.Why You Should Apply
• A company pension scheme is available, 3 x salary life assurance and bonus subject to profitability.• Holiday allowance 25 days per year, plus public holidays.• The chance to join a fantastic growing company.• To become part of a hardworking, dedicated team.• To showcase your current knowledge and skill set in the field.• To be a proactive member of the company.
If you’re the ideal candidate our client is looking for, please send your CV by clicking the APPLY button

120.title: Software Engineer
120.description: Here at AXA, we’re on an exciting journey with the next level of significant investment planned in all UKandI businesses to transform and deliver new digital services, to our customers and streamline and automate our business processes. To help us develop and maintain our software platforms in our Insurance team, we’re looking for a talented individual with superb analytical skills and a passion for making a difference, to join this growing team.As a Software Engineer within the AXA Insurance engineering community you will be working within one of our multi-disciplinary engineering teams to maintain and develop AXA's software platforms using industry best practices and standards. You will work at every stage of the engineering lifecycle from design to production support, using a range of tools and languages, as well as good analytical skills, to be a key influencer in driving continuous improvement and delivery as part of a fast-paced agile environment. If you are a Developer who loves to collaborate and problem solve, whether just starting out in your career or ready for the next step, we want to hear from you.At AXA we’re adopting a Hybrid way of working, empowering our people to balance their time between home and office in a way that works best for them, their team and our customers. What you’ll be doing:  Develop solutions to the required quality, design, coding, performance and security standards. Ensure quality and continuous improvement through design reviews, code reviews and retrospectives. Take collective ownership for the platform, responding to its needs for stability and availability and by being consistent with agreed platform principles. Work to continuously improve the platform through removal of technical debt and championing of new technologies. Provide technical analysis of user requirements to facilitate accurate story estimation. Work closely with colleagues to share knowledge and ensure the continuous growth of our community-oriented environment. Ensure solutions have test coverage with a shift left mindset.  Evaluate the potential for automation to remove manual effort and increase efficiency.

121.title: SOFTWARE ENGINEER
121.description: GMK SOFTWARE SOLUTIONS LIMITED based in Aylesbury, Buckinghamshire offers efficient high quality IT solutions to its customers.The organization has identified the need for experienced professionals to undertake the role of Software Engineer to take responsibility for examining existing software and determining requirements for new or modified systems, investigating, planning, designing, coding and developing software solutions for clients and installing, implementing and maintaining the reliability and security of software systems.The successful applicants be a graduate with a degree level qualification or NQF level 6 or above in a computer related field, or significant experience in a similar position of responsibility.Responsibilities:Applicants to demonstrate technical expertise in Open Identity Manager (OIDM)3.0 (or greater) platform with a focus on implementing Certifications, Access Requests and Provisioning/Workflows in an enterprise-wide deployment.Develop, re-engineering, testing and debugging software codes, OIDM 3.0 connectors and workflows, UI Customization, Online Help, SOA Approval.Custom code development of connectors and adapters in OIM 3.0 or greater is an absolute requirementSupport all Production changes and implementations; coordinate with various SMEs and Project managers on taking development led efforts to ProductionPerform system integration and software designs, development and design document and specification to customer requirementsAble to generate artifacts such as design documents, deployment guides and operational guides as part of ownership of a development work effort or effortsSkills and Qualification Required:Good skills of Windows scripting such as Windows PowerShell scripts.Analytical skills to derive and translate business level information into technical specifications and must be able to evaluate technology from a business and technical perspective.Logical approach to problem solving and analytical skillsJava J2EE, Open Identity Manager are required.Excellent written communication skills are required.

122.title: Software Engineer
122.description:
Want to do the best work of your life? With 24 million customers in 6 countries, make your mark at Europe's leading media and entertainment brand. A workplace where you can proudly be yourself; our people make Sky a truly exciting and inclusive place to work. 
 Sky Advertising Technology provides innovative solutions to Sky's Advertising opportunities including the industry leading AdSmart - that allows our clients to precisely target their adverts to relevant households. As a Software Engineer, you'll be helping to create those systems and be part of the migration of AdTech systems into the Cloud.
 What you'll do:
* Help to build applications that are core to Sky's market leading AdSmart platform * Champion the departments adoption of Cloud technologies * Work with the Automation Tester to ensure we deliver well tested applications with a robust CI/CD pipeline. * Engage with the wider AdTech and Sky developer communities.
 What you'll bring:
* Solid experience of delivering secure, performant, applications in a variety of languages (Java, Go, C#, Python, JavaScript/TypeScript), and SQL in a cloud-based environment (GCP/AWS) * Good experience of Infrastructure as Code (Terraform), Kubernetes clusters and cloud native tools like Big Query, Cloud Composer, Cloud Build (or their AWS equivalents). * Complete commitment to excellent Software Engineering standards. * An appetite to expand your horizons, to look at new technology and assess how best to leverage it.
 Department overview: 
We're the Product Hub. We're the team behind your favourite Sky products, and the platforms that power them. We make every moment magical, everywhere. Our team is made up of self-motivated, big thinkers who have a knack for solving problems and find new ways to captivate millions of customers by putting them at the heart of everything we do. From Sky Glass, Sky Q, Peacock and NOW to news and sports apps, we make entertainment even better and we can't wait to get started on what's next.
 Team Overview
Content Technology and Innovation
Our Content Technology and Innovation team delivers high-quality content to homes, customer devices, businesses and commercial partners across our European markets. With over 2500 colleagues from around the world, we combine our strategic insights, engineering know-how and operational excellence to use the most innovative technologies to create and distribute our award-winning content. 
 The Rewards:
There's a reason people can't stop talking about #LifeAtSky. Our great range of rewards really are something special, here are just a few:
* Sky Q,for the TV you love all in one place * A generous pension package * Private healthcare * Discounted mobile and broadband * Access a wide range of exclusive Sky VIP rewards and experiences 
 Where you'll work:
Osterley:
Our Osterley Campus is a 10-minute walk from Syon Lane train station. Or you can hop on one of our free shuttle buses that run to and from Osterley, Gunnersbury, Ealing Broadway and South Ealing tube stations. There's also plenty of bike shelters and showers.
On campus, you'll find 13 subsidised restaurants, cafes, and a Waitrose. You can keep in shape at our subsidised gym, catch the latest shows and movies at our cinema, get your car washed and even get pampered at our beauty salon. 
 Inclusion:
We take pride in our approach to diversity and inclusion: we've been recognised by The Times and Stonewall for this, and we've committed £30million to support the fight against racial injustice. We've also set ambitious targets for increasing ethnic diversity and representation throughout our organisation. 
At Sky we don't just look at your CV. We're more focused on who you are and your potential. We also know that everyone has a life outside work, so we're happy to discuss flexible working.
And we'll do everything we can to support you during your application. If you need us to make any adjustments to our recruitment process, speak to our recruitment team who will be happy to support you. 
 Why wait? 
Apply now to build an amazing career and be part of a brilliant team. We can't wait to hear from you. 
To find out more about working with us, search #LifeAtSky on social media. A job you love to talk about.
Just so you know: if your application is successful, we'll ask you to complete a criminal record check. And depending on the role you have applied for and the nature of any convictions you may have, we might have to withdraw the offer.

124.title: Software Engineer
124.description:
DWP. Digital with Purpose.
DWP need experienced software engineers to help us compile, build and deploy software services that work for us and for our millions of users.
We're looking for engineers and developers who think, code and craft using Java or Javascript/node.js. Initially you'll be working on transforming the products and services people access through DWP Jobcentres, with regular releases, creating new functionality and critical maintenance.
Our agile teams are using the latest tech and tooling to deliver a generational change to the way DWP works, and to the way people interact with government.
The scale of our engineering challenge is incredible:

We have 1bn lines of code in over 12,000 code repos and 90+ programming languages. That's more lines of codes than there are calories in 7.2m Strawberry Delights.
We run around 294 days' worth of testing every day through automation. You could get a rocket to Mars in that time.
Our APIs receive 173 million requests, and we spin up 280,000 AWS servers every month.
Over 22 million people - 1/3 of the UK's adult population - access our services daily. Over 100,000 colleagues and agents use the kit, tools and systems we roll out. We're one of the biggest payers in Europe with over £195bn payments made annually.

We're working at home a lot at the moment because of Covid-19, and our ongoing offer includes hybrid home/hub based working. Our pension offer is great too - with 27.1% pension contributions - so you can look after your own future while creating solutions that empower others to do the same.
What skills knowledge and experience do you need to show us in your application?

Open source technologies like Java, JavaScript, Node.js.
Developing on cloud-based environments like AWS and Azure.
A good understanding of Test Driven Development (TDD)
SQL and noSQL database applications such as Postgres, MySQL, and MongoDB.
Containerisation tools such as Docker and Kubernetes.
The skills to build up a useful, robust automated test suite to support a continuous deployment environment.
Knowledge and experience of APIs, RESTful services and Microservice Architectures.

Details. Wages. Perks.
You'll join us in one of our digital hubs in the your choice of Birmingham, Blackpool, Leeds, Manchester, Sheffield or Newcastle.
We also all have the tech and tools we need to enable our people to work flexibly, and many of us are working remotely at the moment due to COVID-19.
We offer competitive pay up to £55,666, and a brilliant civil service pension with employer contributions of 27.1%. For a starting salary, for example, of £40,000 that would be nearly £11,000 in your pension pot, from us, each year.
You'll also get a generous leave package starting at 26 days (25 days annual leave plus a day for the Queen's Birthday), plus the ability to take extra days using flexi leave.
We also have a broad benefits package built around your work-life balance which includes:

Flexible working, flexi hours and flexi days
Hybrid working: some time in a hub with the team, some time at home
Family-friendly policies
Time off volunteering and charitable giving
Bring your authentic self to work with 'I Can Be Me in DWP'
Discounts and savings on shopping, fun days out and more
Interest-free loans to buy a bike or a season ticket, so it's even easier for you to get to work and start making a difference
Sports and social activities
Working in an award-winning environment and culture
Professional development, coaching, mentoring and career progression opportunities.

CLICK APPLY for further information and to start an application on Civil Service Jobs.

130.title: Software Engineer
130.description: For more than 70 years, Cerulean has been synonymous with the supply of precision test and measurement equipment solutions for the tobacco industry. With continued release of new devices, Cerulean is committed to delivering the solutions that our customers require, investing a significant proportion of its revenue on in-house research and product development. This commitment demonstrates the Cerulean philosophy of innovation and continuous improvement.Reporting to the Software Manager the successful candidate will be a key member of the software development team responsible for developing software using various technologies of the Microsoft stack. The software developer would be responsible for writing code to Cerulean standards that is used in a varied key products of the company. Coordinating with the hardware engineers to ensure the software produces the desired results. Working in various projects involving various technologies with opportunity to improve and learn.Key Responsibilities· Solid understanding of the development lifecycle focusing on the Microsoft stack.· Create code that meets design specifications, follows standards, and is easy to maintain. 131.title: Software Engineer
131.description:
BBC News offers a wide range of stretching, creative and impactful careers for talented people. We are the team that’s building the future of the BBC, whilst delivering TV, radio and online services to millions of people worldwide every day. 

In the Elections Team we are focused on giving the public clear information about the democratic process. We’re a full-stack team focused on getting accurate information about elections results to our audience quickly, at scale and most importantly clearly. Often our audiences either don’t understand the electoral process, the terminology used or struggle with numbers, and it’s part of the BBC’s remit to help make this clear. 

We offer challenging work but with the time to think and do things right. We value Diversity & Inclusion everywhere at the BBC and encourage people of all backgrounds to apply for the role. 

If you are interested to know more about us, please explore the following links: 


 
 Blogs: https://medium.com/bbc-design-engineering 
 
 
 OpenSource: https://www.bbc.co.uk/opensource/ 
 
 
 GitHub: https://github.com/bbc 
 
 
 General D+E info: https://www.bbc.com/backstage/design-engineering 
 
Technical: 


 
 Our stack is built from JavaScript and GoLang. If you don’t know them, we can train you, so demonstrable skill in: JavaScript, TypeScript, Python, Java, GoLang are all acceptable if you’re willing to learn. 
 
 
 We operate as a DevOps team and own our own infrastructure on AWS; experience of working in this way is a plus. 
 
 
 Knowledge of SQL databases, or any other databases a plus. 
 



 
 Championing new technologies and approaches to ensure our products remain world class. 
 
 
 Collaborating effectively to deliver the best value audience experience. 
 
 
 Ensuring your code meets high quality standards through testing and peer reviews. 
 


People: 


 
 Working with others to get things done in a proactive and positive way. 
 



 
 Working with journalists and designers on new application concepts and building prototypes. 
 
 
 Contributing to an environment of engineering excellence and continuous improvement. 
 
 
 Mentoring and training new team members. 
 
 
 Contributes to creating safe and inclusive working environments. 
 
We’re keen to speak with people who have experience designing, developing and supporting large, complex systems at scale with one or more modern programming languages and/or frameworks. This is a great opportunity to learn new skills and languages. We’d also be keen to see experience of cloud infrastructure and automated testing techniques. 

Experience of project working and professional software development processes including Agile, behaviour driven development and test-driven development would be preferable, as well as supporting software in a production environment. Finally, we value experience communicating effectively with both technical and non-technical colleagues at all levels in an organisation. 

We create and support reliable and scalable, cloud-based systems on Amazon Web Services, use Git and GitHub for version control, continuous integration and continuous deployment. 

                             
                                
                                    Proud member of the Disability Confident employer scheme

For more details please go to Disability Confident.

135.title: Junior or Graduate Software Engineer
135.description: Graduate or Junior Software EngineerEstablished in 1985, Crowder Consulting consists of a growing team of over 120 consulting engineers, software developers and data analysts. As an SME, we are able to offer our leading Water Network Management System, Netbase, to water operators in the UK and internationally. Our flagship Netbase System is a data rich hub that acts as a Digital Twin of our client water operators’ networks, with a suite of best practice applications providing source to tap insights for network monitoring, operation, optimisation, management and regulatory reporting. Our Netbase Digital Services Platform extends the value and insights of the Netbase Data Hub, providing advanced web-based technologies and solutions supporting innovative analytics, operational, field services and leakage activities. Our people are at the heart of what we do, and we’re proud to say we’ve been Investors in People accredited since 2004, testament to our dedication to support all colleagues with their career development. We are looking for Junior Software Engineers or Computer Science graduates to join our Development Team and help drive the ambitious roadmap for our cloud-based solutions and services. The Role – Graduate or Junior Software EngineerAs a Software Engineer, you’ll work with some of the latest technologies and be involved in the end-to-end software development life cycle. You’ll carry out requirements analysis working closely with our in-house domain experts; designing, developing, and testing components, APIs, and applications; monitoring and supporting operational systems and implementing dev-ops best practice and researching new technologies, prototyping, and bringing innovation to our solutions.The PackageAs a Junior or Graduate Software Engineer, you’ll benefit from:• A starting salary of £25,000 (or higher, dependent upon your experience, skills, and qualifications)• Permanent contract, working 37.5 hours per week, Monday to Friday, with flexible start times between 8am and 10am and finish times between 4:30pm and 6:30pm • Employer contributory pension scheme• Annual leave entitlement that increases with length of serviceWe’re based in Birkenhead, although there may be a requirement for you to work from home initially due to the Covid-19 Government restrictions. We’re reviewing a hybrid approach to working post-Covid as suited to business requirements. Our Requirements – Graduate or Junior Software EngineerYou should be enthusiastic about the latest software trends and technologies and have a willingness to learn, progress and grow within the team. You’ll also have: • Degree level education in Computer Science or relevant subject and / or a foundation of experience within a similar software engineering role• Experience of a high-level programming language (Java, Python, NodeJS, TypeScript, C#)• Appreciation of Software Development practices and design (OOAD, DDD, TDD, patterns)Although not essential, exposure to any of the following would be advantageous:• Developing desktop, web, or mobile applications• Cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, GCP, Serverless, Containers) • Web technologies (REST API, HTML5, JavaScript, Angular, React)• Database technologies (Oracle, MySQL, Mongo, DynamoDB, etc)• DevOps Practices and Tools (Configuration as code, CI/CD, Docker)• Experience of working in an agile environmentAll applications for this Junior or Graduate Software Engineer vacancy are to be submitted online, and strictly no agency calls or agency CV submissions.

144.title: Associate Software Engineer
144.description: Are you starting your career as a Software Engineer?Are you looking for an engaging environment with the opportunity to deliver innovative technology?We’re looking for outstanding Software Engineers, who want to contribute to demanding and exciting digital services for the UK Government. Be part of changing the face of public services with the potential to dramatically transform the future of millions of people. Our Engineers build and run applications as part of a multi-functional agile delivery teams. What really excites the successful candidate is problem-solving and the opportunity to deliver technology that carries real value for users. The candidate will be expected to draw value from collaboration with others, actively seek input from colleagues and value a multidisciplinary team over hierarchy.The successful candidate will join Identity and Trust (ID&T) within Shared Channels Experience. ID&T is tasked with accurately establishing customers’ identity when interacting with DWP services regardless of the form of communication, protecting both DWP and the customer while removing the need to repeatedly undergo identification processes throughout the journey.Check out these blogs aboutAs an Associate Software Engineer you will help develop and maintain software products that make up citizen and organisation facing services and contribute towards their design.Working with a team, you will be responsible for the operational stability of the products you build, and be in a position to affect change in the on-going robustness and resilience of those products.You will work within, and contribute to, the overall Software Development Lifecycle Process as part of a multi-functional Agile delivery team focused on one or more products.You will:• Deliver software products which make up services for our citizens to consume.• Ensure system robustness, resilience and stability.• Help design and develop reusable libraries and services and promote reuse across the department.• Collaborate to produce comprehensive suites of automated unit and integration tests to ensure code quality.• Identify and resolve issues preventing delivery or continuation of software engineering activities.

159.title: Software Engineer
159.description: Are you an outstanding Application Engineer with extensive knowledge of C#?Do you think you can contribute to the digital services demand in the DWP?Do you want to help change the face of public services?If the answer to these three question is ‘Yes’ then you could be our next Software Engineer. We’re looking for you to use your C# skills to develop, maintain, change and support an application as part of a multi-functional agile team.What really excites our engineers is problem-solving and the opportunity to deliver innovative technology that carries real value for users. You will be expected to draw value from collaboration with others, actively seek input from colleagues and value a multidisciplinary team over hierarchy.As an Engineering Practice Member you will have access to a range of L&D opportunities to support both your professional and personal development. You will also become part of the software engineering community.As a Software Engineer you will: • Be part of a small team acting as the C# technical lead for the ongoing development of a key system. • Work closely with the product owner and experts across DWP and contribute to the ongoing development, support and administration of the system. • Demonstrate your C# skills on day to day development requirements and project activities, to innovate and to provide technical support for colleagues within a multi-disciplined team. • Provide coaching and mentoring to Application Engineer colleagues and peers by utilising pair-programming. • Implement best-practices to code securely, developing the application to reflect agreed requirements to agreed priorities (C# and SQL). • Deliver quality software which is easy to maintain and clean to operate and troubleshoot issues related to the application – technical and user related. • Provide technical support on a specific application.• Identify and resolve technical issues related to the application.• Need a track record of developing and enhancing legacy systems, refactoring to enhance digital opportunities and up-skilling of colleagues. The system is constantly evolving to meet new requirements, as are the opportunities to enhance the system.

162.title: Software Engineers
162.description: We are seeking multiple Software Engineers at all levels to join a global Marketplace Services Platform that helps brands and retailers grow their sales on Amazon. Whether you have approx. two years commercial / Freelance experience (Level II) or you are a mid-senior Software Engineer (Level III), we would love to hear from you.You will need to be based in the UK or EU and willing to occasionally travel to attend networking and team building events (expenses paid for anyone well outside London). Offering a broad range of strategic, optimisation, management, and advertising services in the UK and internationally, this new Global Marketplace Services Platform helps brands grow their sales on Amazon and other platforms. With a very competitive salary on offer and a superb benefits package that includes Free Amazon Prime, Flexible working, Contributory pension, Technology allowance -£500 one off, 25 Days holiday, your birthday off, access to an industry leading learning platform, Cycle to work scheme, Bike storage (if you attend the office), expect a fantastic opportunity to progress your career and be an integral part of the business helping shape and build the platform.  Reporting to the Technical Lead, the successful Software Engineers will become an integral part of the business helping build and shape this platform as they develop new concepts and transition them to production maturity. To qualify… You should be a Software Engineer /Software Developer / JavaScript Developer / Software Developer / Full Stack Developer / TypeScript Developer / Python Developer or similar who can demonstrate: A degree in computer science, STEM or another numerate subject or be able to show additional commercial experience. A background of commercial or freelance software development.Experience developing web applications, data extraction tools, data pipelines, or ETL processes. An understand the software development life cycle and agile processes. Good communications skills and can express technical challenges in lay-man’s terms. A passion for working with a remote team and agile processes. You are comfortable working to best practices such as continuous integration and deployment, monitoring, code reviews, linting, and testing. Be familiar with SOLID design principles. Technical Skills Our client work with a variety of technologies. The successful candidates should bring at least 2 years (Level II) or approx. 5 years (Level III) experience working with a mix of these skillsLanguage/Tool Skills: JavaScript (highly desired)Typescript (desired)Python (highly desired)SQL (required)Data Skills (highly desired)Numerical Framework such as Numpy, PandasVisualization Frameworks such as D3js, Charting Libraries or BI ToolsBasic Data Analysis and Data Science skillsRelational databases such as PostgresOther Database/warehouse solutions such as Redshift, AWS Glue, Spark, AWS Athena, or MongoDBBI Tools such as Tableau or PowerBIFronted Development Skills (Desired)Backend Frameworks such as Rest, SOAP, or WebSocketFrontend Frameworks such as Angular or DjangoDesign Frameworks such as Material UI or BootstrapBackend Development Skills (Desired)Serverless processesMicroservices and Event driven developmentMessaging and Task QueuesInfrastructure Skills (Desired)HerokuAWS (network security, RDS, Lambda, …)Google FirebaseLinux ServerDocker/KubernetesOur client work in an agile environment and developers will be expected to work with common tools for documentation, code reviews, requirements management, as well as CI and CD. This is a rare opportunity for a passionate Software Engineer to make a real impact joining a rapidly growing, well-funded start up. Get in touch… As part of your application, please provide a brief summary of your relevant technical experience and skills, as well as your desired level and desired level and current or last salary. More junior candidates (Level II) can expect £40k to 55k depending on skills and locationWhilst more experienced / mid weight candidates (Level III) can expect £55k to 65k depending on skills and location.

165.title: Software Engineer
165.description:
Please note: You must have the Right To Work in the UK to be considered for this role.
Want to use your coding skills in a different way whilst working from home?
BPAS are looking for an enthusiastic developer with Microsoft SQL, C# and JavaScript programming skills to be involved in the full system development lifecycle from ‘idea’ to ‘delivery’.
As a software engineer you will be directly contributing to making a real difference in BPAS. You will be involved and valued for your contribution in a small, friendly, highly skilled IT team supporting an organisation that is extremely ambitious in its plans for the future.
The role:
You will provide a high-quality software development and systems integration service to meet BPAS’s evolving business requirements. With a good understanding and practical experience in software development you will design, code, verify, test, document, amend and maintain complex programs/scripts and integration software services to achieve well engineered outcomes.
About You:
We are looking for a confident and articulate software engineer with solid “hands-on” experience in a similar role. You’ll be technically adept in Microsoft SQL, JavaScript and jQuery/ Angular, C#, .Net with good working knowledge of Visual Studio, SQL Server Management Studio and Subversion, Git or similar.
You will have an ability to communicate with colleagues at all levels of the organisation in a positive and friendly manner and a methodical, disciplined, and analytical approach to problem solving.
You will bring;

Qualified to a degree level in a Computer Science or Technology discipline or be able to demonstrate work experience to an equivalent level
Experience of investigating, identifying, and contributing to the resolution of software and technical issues, engaging effectively with third party suppliers and specialist resources as appropriate.
Technical coding ability
Experience in systems integration
Experience developing and maintaining system documentation using appropriate tools and techniques.

What we can offer you:
As a valued member of our IT team you will benefit from training opportunities supporting you to develop your skills and knowledge.
You’ll also have access to the BPAS Pension Plan, generous annual leave entitlement, the opportunity to attend in-house conferences, and gain access to the BHSF benefits plan.
Further Information:
Location: Home based or a hybrid arrangement incorporating our Head Office at Stratford upon Avon depending on candidate preference.
There is an expectation that the successful candidate will undertake some out of hours working for maintenance activities which will be paid as overtime. There will also be some very occasional travel to our units - travel expenses will be reimbursed.
Salary: Competitve dependent on skills and experience.
Working pattern and hours: 36 hours flexible across the week Monday to Friday in core business hours
For an informal chat about this role please call Chris Sharkey on 07540115937.

166.title: Software Engineer
166.description: What the job is about:New customer projects and a changing architecture landscape result in a bigger workload in which you can help us out by joining our Software Engineering team.As a Java Software Engineer, you’ll work on our core product ‘Miles’, an ERP software package covering all business aspects of a modern leasing company, automotive finance, or mobility provider.You’ll either work on improving the current application, developing new modules, or sometimes implement a customization project for one of the customers.'Miles’ is built in Java (Java 8-11 / Quarkus / Smart GWT). The database technologies that are currently used are Oracle, SQL Server, and expanding to PostgreSQL.Innovation is important, that’s why we’re making the shift to a next-generation microservices architecture with a fully integrated CI/CD pipeline, using technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes, and Kafka.You will work in an international organization, but one that has an informal atmosphere. It’s an environment in which you can take responsibility and initiative, share your ideas, and take part in the discussion.Your interests and skills:You have a bachelor's or master's degree in Computer Science, Informatics, or an equivalent degree.You are passionate about building state-of-the-art solutions in Java Enterprise and you have some experience or interest in other current technologies.You love solving problems in a creative manner together with your team. You do this in a methodical way and continuously strive for results and quality.Since Sofico is an international company, being fluent in English is important. You might be interested in our extended technology stack: Java JEE (8-11), Java Eclipse Microprofile, Quarkus, Junit, SQL, Oracle, MS SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Bamboo, Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes, Kafka, Helm Charts, Git, ...We are looking for junior, medior as well as senior profiles.What we offer:The opportunity to be part of a company that has been in business for over 30 years and is doubling in size every 5 years.An extensive onboarding program for you to become familiar with the product and the organization.A community-driven organization supporting you in all aspects of your daily job, heavily focusing on knowledge sharing, best practices, and training.The possibility to keep learning, acquire the desired skills, and be the driver of your own career.Of course, an attractive salary package based on your knowledge and experience with a company car.And in a normal situation, coffee, tea, water are available at the office, occasional after works drinks, a BBQ in the summer, and lots of other fun team events.

167.title: Software Engineer
167.description:
Software Engineer | Cheshire | 37.5 hours per week| £35,000 - £42,000Guardian Controls is an electronics company specialising in the design and manufacture of energy efficient controls and monitoring to the refrigeration industry in the UK, Europe and internationally.We are growing and ambitious in our plans for the future and are looking to recruit a Software Engineer who will focus on embedded industrial software with control systems encompassing analogue IO, digital IO, VSDs, sensors and actuators. The right candidate will have 4-5 years commercial experience and be keen to evolve and apply their skills further.You will work Monday to Friday - 9:00am to 5:00pm. There will be some flexibility in the number of hours worked and working days for the right candidate. The probationary period is 4 months, once completed this will be a permanent position.You Should Ideally Be Capable Of
• Excellent C and C++ programming skills.• Java, Javascript and HTML desired.• Assembly language with embedded Atmel and Microchip microcontrollers• Good Understanding of Windows development with C/C++ and MFC. • C# desired but not essential.• Good understanding of serial communications interfaces• Serial protocols such as Modbus desired• Serial device interfaces such as I2C and SPI desirable.• Understanding of TCP/IP protocol stack desired (TCP/IP, DHCP etc.)• Understanding of socket-based communications (TCP / UDP and higher layers: FTP, HTTP.• Knowledge of lower layers of TCP-IP stack is desirable, but not essential.• Understanding of cloud-based services and communications.• Understanding of WIFI communications• Experience with small footprint embedded systems development• Understanding of control systems theory with appreciation for industrial environment.• Understanding of SVN and git source control systems
Role ResponsibilitiesTaking direction from our head of engineering you will be responsible for the development of architecture, design, implementation, test and roll out of software for control systems in the refrigeration industry, both UK and Internationally. Working on a range of existing and new products, in varying hardware platforms to implement new control systems or modify and release improved features for existing products. You will work on small footprint embedded micro controllers with our in-house designed hardware with software interfacing to the hardware, reading sensors and controlling actuators. Our products are becoming more internet connected, an understanding of TCP-IP would be desirable.Why You Should Apply
• A company pension scheme is available, 3 x salary life assurance and bonus subject to profitability.• Holiday allowance 25 days per year, plus public holidays.• The chance to join a fantastic growing company.• To become part of a hardworking, dedicated team.• To showcase your current knowledge and skill set in the field.• To be a proactive member of the company.
If you’re the ideal candidate our client is looking for, please send your CV by clicking the APPLY button

170.title: Software Engineer
170.description: Here at AXA, we’re on an exciting journey with the next level of significant investment planned in all UKandI businesses to transform and deliver new digital services, to our customers and streamline and automate our business processes. To help us develop and maintain our software platforms in our Insurance team, we’re looking for a talented individual with superb analytical skills and a passion for making a difference, to join this growing team.As a Software Engineer within the AXA Insurance engineering community you will be working within one of our multi-disciplinary engineering teams to maintain and develop AXA's software platforms using industry best practices and standards. You will work at every stage of the engineering lifecycle from design to production support, using a range of tools and languages, as well as good analytical skills, to be a key influencer in driving continuous improvement and delivery as part of a fast-paced agile environment. If you are a Developer who loves to collaborate and problem solve, whether just starting out in your career or ready for the next step, we want to hear from you.At AXA we’re adopting a Hybrid way of working, empowering our people to balance their time between home and office in a way that works best for them, their team and our customers. What you’ll be doing:  Develop solutions to the required quality, design, coding, performance and security standards. Ensure quality and continuous improvement through design reviews, code reviews and retrospectives. Take collective ownership for the platform, responding to its needs for stability and availability and by being consistent with agreed platform principles. Work to continuously improve the platform through removal of technical debt and championing of new technologies. Provide technical analysis of user requirements to facilitate accurate story estimation. Work closely with colleagues to share knowledge and ensure the continuous growth of our community-oriented environment. Ensure solutions have test coverage with a shift left mindset.  Evaluate the potential for automation to remove manual effort and increase efficiency.

171.title: SOFTWARE ENGINEER
171.description: GMK SOFTWARE SOLUTIONS LIMITED based in Aylesbury, Buckinghamshire offers efficient high quality IT solutions to its customers.The organization has identified the need for experienced professionals to undertake the role of Software Engineer to take responsibility for examining existing software and determining requirements for new or modified systems, investigating, planning, designing, coding and developing software solutions for clients and installing, implementing and maintaining the reliability and security of software systems.The successful applicants be a graduate with a degree level qualification or NQF level 6 or above in a computer related field, or significant experience in a similar position of responsibility.Responsibilities:Applicants to demonstrate technical expertise in Open Identity Manager (OIDM)3.0 (or greater) platform with a focus on implementing Certifications, Access Requests and Provisioning/Workflows in an enterprise-wide deployment.Develop, re-engineering, testing and debugging software codes, OIDM 3.0 connectors and workflows, UI Customization, Online Help, SOA Approval.Custom code development of connectors and adapters in OIM 3.0 or greater is an absolute requirementSupport all Production changes and implementations; coordinate with various SMEs and Project managers on taking development led efforts to ProductionPerform system integration and software designs, development and design document and specification to customer requirementsAble to generate artifacts such as design documents, deployment guides and operational guides as part of ownership of a development work effort or effortsSkills and Qualification Required:Good skills of Windows scripting such as Windows PowerShell scripts.Analytical skills to derive and translate business level information into technical specifications and must be able to evaluate technology from a business and technical perspective.Logical approach to problem solving and analytical skillsJava J2EE, Open Identity Manager are required.Excellent written communication skills are required.

172.title: Software Engineer
172.description:
Want to do the best work of your life? With 24 million customers in 6 countries, make your mark at Europe's leading media and entertainment brand. A workplace where you can proudly be yourself; our people make Sky a truly exciting and inclusive place to work. 
 Sky Advertising Technology provides innovative solutions to Sky's Advertising opportunities including the industry leading AdSmart - that allows our clients to precisely target their adverts to relevant households. As a Software Engineer, you'll be helping to create those systems and be part of the migration of AdTech systems into the Cloud.
 What you'll do:
* Help to build applications that are core to Sky's market leading AdSmart platform * Champion the departments adoption of Cloud technologies * Work with the Automation Tester to ensure we deliver well tested applications with a robust CI/CD pipeline. * Engage with the wider AdTech and Sky developer communities.
 What you'll bring:
* Solid experience of delivering secure, performant, applications in a variety of languages (Java, Go, C#, Python, JavaScript/TypeScript), and SQL in a cloud-based environment (GCP/AWS) * Good experience of Infrastructure as Code (Terraform), Kubernetes clusters and cloud native tools like Big Query, Cloud Composer, Cloud Build (or their AWS equivalents). * Complete commitment to excellent Software Engineering standards. * An appetite to expand your horizons, to look at new technology and assess how best to leverage it.
 Department overview: 
We're the Product Hub. We're the team behind your favourite Sky products, and the platforms that power them. We make every moment magical, everywhere. Our team is made up of self-motivated, big thinkers who have a knack for solving problems and find new ways to captivate millions of customers by putting them at the heart of everything we do. From Sky Glass, Sky Q, Peacock and NOW to news and sports apps, we make entertainment even better and we can't wait to get started on what's next.
 Team Overview
Content Technology and Innovation
Our Content Technology and Innovation team delivers high-quality content to homes, customer devices, businesses and commercial partners across our European markets. With over 2500 colleagues from around the world, we combine our strategic insights, engineering know-how and operational excellence to use the most innovative technologies to create and distribute our award-winning content. 
 The Rewards:
There's a reason people can't stop talking about #LifeAtSky. Our great range of rewards really are something special, here are just a few:
* Sky Q,for the TV you love all in one place * A generous pension package * Private healthcare * Discounted mobile and broadband * Access a wide range of exclusive Sky VIP rewards and experiences 
 Where you'll work:
Osterley:
Our Osterley Campus is a 10-minute walk from Syon Lane train station. Or you can hop on one of our free shuttle buses that run to and from Osterley, Gunnersbury, Ealing Broadway and South Ealing tube stations. There's also plenty of bike shelters and showers.
On campus, you'll find 13 subsidised restaurants, cafes, and a Waitrose. You can keep in shape at our subsidised gym, catch the latest shows and movies at our cinema, get your car washed and even get pampered at our beauty salon. 
 Inclusion:
We take pride in our approach to diversity and inclusion: we've been recognised by The Times and Stonewall for this, and we've committed £30million to support the fight against racial injustice. We've also set ambitious targets for increasing ethnic diversity and representation throughout our organisation. 
At Sky we don't just look at your CV. We're more focused on who you are and your potential. We also know that everyone has a life outside work, so we're happy to discuss flexible working.
And we'll do everything we can to support you during your application. If you need us to make any adjustments to our recruitment process, speak to our recruitment team who will be happy to support you. 
 Why wait? 
Apply now to build an amazing career and be part of a brilliant team. We can't wait to hear from you. 
To find out more about working with us, search #LifeAtSky on social media. A job you love to talk about.
Just so you know: if your application is successful, we'll ask you to complete a criminal record check. And depending on the role you have applied for and the nature of any convictions you may have, we might have to withdraw the offer.

174.title: Software Engineer
174.description:
DWP. Digital with Purpose.
DWP need experienced software engineers to help us compile, build and deploy software services that work for us and for our millions of users.
We're looking for engineers and developers who think, code and craft using Java or Javascript/node.js. Initially you'll be working on transforming the products and services people access through DWP Jobcentres, with regular releases, creating new functionality and critical maintenance.
Our agile teams are using the latest tech and tooling to deliver a generational change to the way DWP works, and to the way people interact with government.
The scale of our engineering challenge is incredible:

We have 1bn lines of code in over 12,000 code repos and 90+ programming languages. That's more lines of codes than there are calories in 7.2m Strawberry Delights.
We run around 294 days' worth of testing every day through automation. You could get a rocket to Mars in that time.
Our APIs receive 173 million requests, and we spin up 280,000 AWS servers every month.
Over 22 million people - 1/3 of the UK's adult population - access our services daily. Over 100,000 colleagues and agents use the kit, tools and systems we roll out. We're one of the biggest payers in Europe with over £195bn payments made annually.

We're working at home a lot at the moment because of Covid-19, and our ongoing offer includes hybrid home/hub based working. Our pension offer is great too - with 27.1% pension contributions - so you can look after your own future while creating solutions that empower others to do the same.
What skills knowledge and experience do you need to show us in your application?

Open source technologies like Java, JavaScript, Node.js.
Developing on cloud-based environments like AWS and Azure.
A good understanding of Test Driven Development (TDD)
SQL and noSQL database applications such as Postgres, MySQL, and MongoDB.
Containerisation tools such as Docker and Kubernetes.
The skills to build up a useful, robust automated test suite to support a continuous deployment environment.
Knowledge and experience of APIs, RESTful services and Microservice Architectures.

Details. Wages. Perks.
You'll join us in one of our digital hubs in the your choice of Birmingham, Blackpool, Leeds, Manchester, Sheffield or Newcastle.
We also all have the tech and tools we need to enable our people to work flexibly, and many of us are working remotely at the moment due to COVID-19.
We offer competitive pay up to £55,666, and a brilliant civil service pension with employer contributions of 27.1%. For a starting salary, for example, of £40,000 that would be nearly £11,000 in your pension pot, from us, each year.
You'll also get a generous leave package starting at 26 days (25 days annual leave plus a day for the Queen's Birthday), plus the ability to take extra days using flexi leave.
We also have a broad benefits package built around your work-life balance which includes:

Flexible working, flexi hours and flexi days
Hybrid working: some time in a hub with the team, some time at home
Family-friendly policies
Time off volunteering and charitable giving
Bring your authentic self to work with 'I Can Be Me in DWP'
Discounts and savings on shopping, fun days out and more
Interest-free loans to buy a bike or a season ticket, so it's even easier for you to get to work and start making a difference
Sports and social activities
Working in an award-winning environment and culture
Professional development, coaching, mentoring and career progression opportunities.

CLICK APPLY for further information and to start an application on Civil Service Jobs.

180.title: Software Engineer
180.description: For more than 70 years, Cerulean has been synonymous with the supply of precision test and measurement equipment solutions for the tobacco industry. With continued release of new devices, Cerulean is committed to delivering the solutions that our customers require, investing a significant proportion of its revenue on in-house research and product development. This commitment demonstrates the Cerulean philosophy of innovation and continuous improvement.Reporting to the Software Manager the successful candidate will be a key member of the software development team responsible for developing software using various technologies of the Microsoft stack. The software developer would be responsible for writing code to Cerulean standards that is used in a varied key products of the company. Coordinating with the hardware engineers to ensure the software produces the desired results. Working in various projects involving various technologies with opportunity to improve and learn.Key Responsibilities· Solid understanding of the development lifecycle focusing on the Microsoft stack.· Create code that meets design specifications, follows standards, and is easy to maintain.
